DOC.HEAD: Eds: SUBS the TITUSVILLE, Pa.-dated Nelson item to restore dropped word `attack' in lead.
DOC.TEXT: Tim Nelson, 53, a retired WTIV radio announcer and Titusville Area Chamber of Commerce President, died Saturday of a heart attack. Nelson worked for WTIV for 29 years, beginning in 1955. He was a station announcer and also served as program director. Nelson left the station in 1980 to work for the chamber. Nelson was a member of a number of community organizations, including the Titusville Kiwanis Club and the Pennsylvania Chamber of Commerce Executives. He is survived by his wife, Dorothy, and four daughters.
